page.title: 02CHADWELL ST. MARY
page.content: { Chadwell}is a town just up the hill north of Tilbury. It has a bit of everything.It has a wood,two chapels,and a church,two schools, and a library. The origin of the town's name is a very strange sort of story: A man by the name of Chad built a water well.Gradually a town grew up around this well,and the town inherited the name of "Chad's well". The site of the well can be seen at the foot of the hill to this day.Chad was later called "St. Chad";perhaps he baptised converts in this well. The "St. Mary" was added because that is the name of the parish church,which is an attractive, flint-faced building with a Norman tower.It stands at the crest of the hill, next to the crossroads.
